body_html: Hi @ezyang , I have the same problem. I installed Pytorch using pip. But first I installed the cpu version, then I uninstall them by using 'pip uninstall torch torchvision'. It turns out successful. Then I install the gpu version, using 'pip install ll http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu92/torch-0.4.1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl' and 'pip install torchvision'. But after all that, I check torch.cuda.is_available(), it is False. And the error message comes when I implement device_gpu = torch.device("cuda") ... save_features_for_models(model_names, train_valid_dataloader, train_valid_dataloader_299, device_gpu, 'train_valid')

body: Hi @ezyang , I have the same problem. I installed Pytorch using pip. But first I installed the cpu version, then I uninstall them by using 'pip uninstall torch torchvision'. It turns out successful. Then I install the gpu version, using  'pip install ll http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu92/torch-0.4.1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl' and 'pip install torchvision'. But after all that, I check torch.cuda.is_available(), it is False. And the error message comes when I implement device_gpu = torch.device("cuda") ... save_features_for_models(model_names, train_valid_dataloader, train_valid_dataloader_299, device_gpu, 'train_valid')
